list_definition.definition: a small, sharp piece of steel with a hole (called an eye) at one end for thread, used in sewing etc
any of various instruments of a long narrow pointed shape
(in a compass etc) a moving pointer
the thin, sharp-pointed leaf of a pine, fir etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The Christmas tree tends to drop all its needles.

list_ex_of_english: The application of a very sharp needle with a tip in atomic dimensions is used to scan material surfaces very closely.

In the prison for males, social workers from a non-governmental organization exchanged sterile syringes and needles for used equipment three times a week.
Death of cercariae was pronounced when they failed to respond to mechanical stimulation with a fine needle.
This occurs when a needle accidentally perforates the skin of the hand, usually the palm.

Encapsulated larvae were removed from the intermediate host's tissue and teased from their capsules with very fine needles under the dissecting microscope.
